content: Investments Insurance CPF Asked by Mango LinAsked on 17 Jun 2019Hello All, do you know which bank will the Prudential CPF investment be returned back to? I heard that I need to inform the bank to return the money back to my CPF OA so I can use it for my BTO? Hello All, do you know which bank will the Prudential CPF investment be returned back to? I heard that I need to inform the bank to return the money back to my CPF OA so I can use it for my BTO?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Elijah LeeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 30 Jul 2019Funds will be returned to the bank that you opened your CPF investment account with. It will be a local bank. The bank will hold it for a period of time (3-4 weeks) before transferring it to CPF. Hence if you need the liquidated funds to be moved to CPF fast, you need to give specific instruction to them to move it.3 comments10

See all 3 comments Eric Chia18 Jun 2019To add on, there are 3 local banks that your account can be with - DBS, UOB or OCBC. And you can call the respective bank to transfer the money back to CPF after it's returned to the bank to accelerate the process. OCBC ATM also serves the same function!Mango Lin30 Jul 2019Thank You!

Vincent Tan Wen Bin, Assistant Vice President at Thinkers AllianceLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 18 Jun 2019Assuming you purchase this Prudential investment using your CPFIA,Once the investment is redeemded, it will be refunded back to your CPFIA.
You will need to go to the bank to request for a refund from your CPFIA back to your CPF OA account.0 comments1
